text.p: Here are the highlights from Swiss newspapers on Tuesday:
- Basle pharmaceuticals giant Roche will take over Rhone Poulenc Rorer's vitamin and tonic brand name product line in Europe. Sales of these products are expected to reach over $60 million.
- Technology group Sulzer and Japan's Ebara Corporation ended their cross shareholding on December 20.

- Forbo Holding AG sold its stake in Germany's Forbo Grenzach GmbH, a wallpaper factory, effective at the end of the year. - Novex Ergonom AG is taking over Aebi & Cie, a producer of wooden furniture. Aebi's 50 employees will lose their jobs.
- Swiss Foreign Minister Flavio Cotti on Monday rejected demands made by Jewish and American groups to immediately set up a fund to pay Nazi victims.
- Siemens will take over CS Holding's stake in the industrial sector of Elektrowatt for 1.1 billion Swiss francs.
- Swissair subsidiary Crossair forecasts a 12 percent sales increase to 800 million Swiss francs for 1997.
- The German Mark on Monday rose to its highest level in three years against the Swiss franc. In Zurich, 100 D-Marks cost over 86 Swiss francs.
